intro: Campanula finitima, commonly known as the Sicilian bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Campanula finitima is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to care for.
